Free Type 9 Enneagram Panel

  • Tuesday, May 4, 2021
  • 1:30 PM 4:30 PM 13:30 16:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

What you may not know about the Ichazo-Naranjo Type 9
When: Tuesday, May 4, 2021
Fee: FREE but must register here
Time: 1:30-4:00, PDT (California time)* Daylight saving time changes 3-11-21
Format: One 2.5-hour online event
Where: On Zoom

Online Panels: Deep Dive Series
All of the panelists are self-typed, and Katherine has confirmed their type and Tritype®. This is important because, historically, some ‘type panels’ have had panelists that have been mistyped. Mistyping is an easy mistake, but it is problematic when viewers end up mistyping due to their identification with a mistyped panelist.

Learn about the key nuances of Type 9 as originally taught by Oscar Ichazo and Claudio Naranjo and validated by tens of thousands of Katherine's qualitative research interviews.

What are 8s like as Coaches or Therapists?

  • Thursday, January 14, 2021
  • 4:30 PM 6:30 PM 16:30 18:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

How do I work with an Enneagram Type 8?
What are 8s like as Coaches or Therapists?
What are the advantages of working with Intimate (Sexual) Instinctual Types?


Or... Who needs to feel like they are running from Dinosaurs?

Katherine, as a coach, and Spencer Chernick, as a therapist, discuss how to work with all the nine types, especially the 8.

Spencer, an 8 with the 846 Tritype, grew up knowing his Enneagram Tritype and his sexual/social Instinctual Stacking. He feels that knowing how to work with the intensity of his sx846 Tritype helped him navigate his way through school.

Spencer Chernick is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. He specializes in ADHD, Couples, Teens, Children, Self-Esteem, Enneagram, Grief, and Life Transitions. He also conducted a study of the Enneagram and conflict management.

When: Thursday, January 14, 2021
Fee: FREE (must register to attend)
Meeting Time: 4:30-6:30 pm, PST (California time)
Format: One 2-hour online event
Where: On Zoom

Aug
4
to Sep 1
Online Courses

Enneagram Centers 5-week MasterClass- Advanced Series

  • Tue, Aug 4, 2020 1:30 PM 13:30 Tue, Sep 1, 2020 4:30 PM 16:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

Enneagram Centers 5-week MasterClass - Advanced Series
When: August 4, 2020 to September 1, 2020
Fee: $375 ($50 savings) Early Bird Special until July 21st, then $425 after July 21st, 2020
Format: Five online classes, 3 hours long, meeting once a week on Tuesdays
Day: Tuesdays
Time: 1:30-4:30 Pacific Time (3 hours)
Dates: August 4, 11, 18, 25, September 1, 2020
How: Zoom (free download, available here) - Make sure you have a camera on your computer!
Recorded: All breakout groups are not recorded. All teaching material recorded unless otherwise specified. Recording available 1 week after the course, for a limited time.
Prerequisite: *Required for certification with Katherine Chernick Fauvre, but open to anyone

Katherine will be teaching a more advanced in-depth masterclass on the Enneagram centers of intelligence in August 2020. She will discuss aspects of the centers that many do not know. It will be a deep dive exploring the many ways to evaluate and understand the 3 centers and will explain the meaning and significance of the 3 centers in relationship to one another and in relationship to the 9 Enneagram types. It will cover why the 3 types within a center share the same basic fears and concerns but use modified strategies to create the balance needed to ensure survival.

You will learn:

  • To see the world of each center and why each type does what they do

  • To understand the key information embedded in each defense strategy

  • To learn how to release areas of constriction within each center

  • To distinguish between common look-a-likes

  • To follow the dynamic flow within the Enneagram centers, types, and lines of connection

  • To discern the meaning of the similarities and differences of the types within each center


These dynamic patterns create the movement that flows from one type to another around the Enneagram in a number of ways. These patterns trigger the change needed to bring into existence new ways of working with rigid patterns such as the passions, fixations, and convictions. When understood, one can recognize and modify the negative emotions associated with the passions, the rigid beliefs associated with the fixations, and the reactive and impulsive behaviors associated with the convictions of each type.

It will include the ways the instincts, passions, fixations, talk styles, type statements, and dichotomies, etc., are in place to manage life stressors but become rigid and inflexible, which stops the flow needed to maintain harmonious movement. Understanding the relationship of the types with respect to the center in which they reside, and their lines of connections, reveals ways to interrupt negative patterns and open new pathways to create positive and life-enhancing change.

Click here to register now and reserve your spot!

View Event →

Fee: FREE
Format: One online meeting, 2 hours in length, one time, on July 23th
Day: Thursday
Time: 1:30-3:30 Pacific Time (2 hours)
Dates: Thursday, July 23, 2020
How: Zoom (free download, available here) - Make sure you have a camera on your computer!
Recorded: This meeting will be recorded.

Join Katherine for Part 2 of her Free Q&A series on how to interpret her NEW Enneagram Tritype Test v6! In this in-depth, 3-hour event, Katherine will show you how to find the special features and benefits of her NEW Enneagram Tritype Test v6 7-2-20.

Retake the updated NEW Enneagram Tritype Test v6 to have these benefits

You will learn what your Enneastyle Questionnaire and Enneacard choices can reveal to you about yourself and others. You will discover how your Analogous Enneaspread identifies your self-image and how your Tritype Enneaspread identifies key features of your potential Enneagram Type and Tritype. When the Enneaspreads are compared and contrasted, they reveal additional patterns.

You will begin to understand how you can gain profound, insightful personal growth from understanding your NEW Enneagram Tritype Test v6 results. The "Show Answers" tab on the results page also lets you see all of the adjectives, Enneacards, and Instinctual Subtype cards that you chose. Katherine's NEW Enneagram Tritype Test v6 is an excellent tool for coaches, therapists, spiritual advisors, and Enneagram enthusiasts!

In-Depth Inquiry Process 9 Week MasterClass

  • Tue, May 19, 2020 1:30 PM 13:30 Tue, Jul 14, 2020 4:30 PM 16:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

In-depth Inquiry Process 9 Week MasterClass
Beginning May 19, 2020 to July 14, 2020
Fee: $545 ($150 savings) Early Bird Special until May 2nd, then $700 after May 2nd, 2020
Format: Nine online classes, 3 hours in length, meeting once a week on Tuesdays
Day: Tuesdays
Time: 1:30-4:30 Pacific Time (3 hours)
Dates: May 19, 26, June 2, 9, 16, 23, 30, July 7, 14, 2020
How: Zoom (free download, available here) - Make sure you have a camera on your computer!
Recorded: All breakout groups are not recorded. All teaching material recorded unless otherwise specified. Recording available 1 week after the course, for a limited time.
Prerequisite: *Required for certification with Katherine Chernick Fauvre but open to anyone

Master Class - In-depth Inquiry Process Intro: An advanced 9-week course on how to guide others and coach them through the In-Depth Inquiry Process. This course includes how to track, tag, assess, interpret and neutralize painful and crystalized emotional memories. These memories can be seen in the external clues displayed in one's body language, physical gestures, facial expressions, and heard in tone and speech patterns.

These external expressions reveal the deeper internal emotional states that need the opportunity to be expressed, tagged and neutralized to break up rigid patterns within the defense strategy. Appropriate for experienced Enneagram teachers, coaches, therapists, spiritual directors and enthusiasts that wish to learn how to type and guide others using the Enneagram of Personality System.

"Katherine has the ability to synthesize material from a variety of sources and to organize it in a way that offers cohesion and insight.... she has made a point to study with everyone who has taught this topic, and made powerful contributions with her own research on the inner world of the types, Tritypes and subtypes...."
-Enneagram Monthly

Feb

TrueType Part 3: Are You or Someone Else Mistyped - Types 3, 5, & 9

  • Tue, Feb 11, 2020 1:30 PM 13:30 Tue, Feb 25, 2020 4:30 PM 16:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

TrueType Part 3: Are You or Someone Else Mistyped - Types 3, 5, & 9
The Most Commonly Mistyped Enneagram Types, Master Class Series
Beginning February 11, 2020 to February 25, 2020
Fee: $375 Early Bird Special until January 29 ($150 savings), then $525 after January 29
Format: Three online classes, 3 hours in length, meeting once a week on Tuesdays
Day: Tuesdays
Time: February 4, 2020, from 1:30-4:30 Pacific Time (3 hours)
Dates: February 4, 11, 18, 2020
February 11: Type 3
February 18: Type 5
February 25: Type 9
How: Zoom (free download, available here) - Make sure you have a camera on your computer!
Recorded: All teaching material is recorded unless otherwise specified. For privacy, all breakout groups are not recorded. Course replay available 1 week after the course, for absences only.
Prerequisite: *Required for certification with Katherine Chernick Fauvre but open to anyone
Special note: These are Advanced Master Classes covering the ‘Original’ descriptions of the types by the originators of the Enneagram, Oscar Ichazo, and Dr. Claudio Naranjo beginning in 1970.

Katherine includes the original work of Ichazo and Naranjo and her findings from 35 years of study, tens of thousands of Enneastyle Questionnaire Results, in-depth interviews, Enneacards Test Results, and years of working with the Enneagram and many other personality typologies. When taught together, in concert so to speak, these perspectives shed new light on what constitutes type… answering many questions as to why different descriptions of the types have emerged and why.

It also raises new questions regarding the ongoing debates regarding what constitutes nature vs. nurture. The Enneagram of Personality was first taught in 1970 when progressive beliefs suggested that nurturing had a greater influence on the personality that previously believed.

Fifty years later with so many advances in the brain sciences, DNA and gnomes, etc., some of these earlier beliefs have been modified by scholars that recognize that both nature and nurture are influential in our maturational development. Current debates discuss which personality traits are due to nature and which traits are due to the nurturing we either did or did not receive as a child.

Course Description:
Advanced Material discussing the original oral dissemination of the Enneagram as taught by Oscar Ichazo and Dr. Claudio Naranjo.

• Are you or someone else mistyped?
• Do you know the Types that are most commonly mistyped because key aspects of the types were not fully transmitted in their original form?
• Do you know what the original descriptions of the Types were prior to any books or publications?
• Do you know Ichazo’s Enneagons and fixations and why they are important keys to self-actualization?
• Do you know Dr. Naranjo's teachings of the neuroses and potential pathology of each of the Types?
• Are you typing based on behaviors rather than motivations?
• Are you typing based on the levels of health rather than on the type’s core fears and idealized images?
• Are you typing based on integration and disintegration or stress and security rather than on the actual type?
• Do you know what the internal dilemma and dichotomies are within each Type?

The first dissemination of the Enneagram types came from Oscar Ichazo in 1970 in Arica, Chile followed by Dr. Claudio Naranjo adding to Ichazo’s work in 1971-1973 in Berkeley, California. These early transmissions were oral and did not include books or written teachings by these two creators. A therapist, Kathy Speeth who grew up in the Gurdjieff Work, was dating Naranjo in 1971. She was a part of Naranjo’s study groups Seekers After Truth (SAT), which included the Enneagram aspects of the curriculum. It was actually Kathy Speeth who created the first, physical handouts for study groups, and then later taught the Enneagram at ITP in Menlo Park, California.

Because Katherine has had access to all of these teachers and this information, she wants to share any misunderstandings in the dissemination of the Types and Subtypes so that people have the opportunity to discover their TrueType and take advantage of the interventions that are available.

There are important points that have either been left out or added to each Type that will change your perception of how the Types are commonly portrayed, and these points make it easier to identify and understand your TrueType.

These classes will include the original description of the Enneagram Types, and what was left out or placed in another Enneagram Type. Due to these omissions in the transmission of the Enneagram, mistypings became inevitable.

This course is about correcting and discovering the importance of accurately typing, so don’t miss a chance to see how the Types were meant to be disseminated and what we have learned since the first oral transmissions of the Enneagram!

To get an idea of where Katherine is going with this information, watch Katherine’s 2 videos on errors in the transmission of the Enneagram here:

Google Hangout #13

Google Hangout #14

• Are you typing based on integration and disintegration or stress and security?

The first and more accurate dissemination of the types came from Ichazo and Naranjo in 1970 in Arica, Chile. The early transmissions did not include books or written teachings by these creators. A therapist, Kathy Speeth who grew up in the Gurdjieff Work, was the girlfriend of Dr. Claudio Naranjo at the time, in 1971.  Together, they created Seekers After Truth (SAT) study groups and included the Enneagram as part of their curriculum.  It was actually Kathy Speeth who initially created the first, physical handouts for study groups, and then later taught the Enneagram at CIIS and at ITP.

Because Katherine has had access to all of these teachers and this information, she wants to clear up any misunderstandings in the dissemination of the Types and Subtypes so that people have the opportunity to discover their TrueType and take advantage of the interventions that are available.

There are important points that have either been left out or added to each Type that will change your perception of how the Types are commonly portrayed, and these points make it easier to identify and understand your TrueType.

These classes will include the original description of the Enneagram Types, and what was left out or placed in another Enneagram Type. Due to these omissions in the transmission of the Enneagram, mistypings became inevitable.

This course is about correcting and discovering the importance of accurately typing, so don’t miss a chance to see how the Types were meant to be disseminated!

Enneagram Type Lexicon, 6-week Master Class

  • Tue, Oct 29, 2019 2:00 PM 14:00 Tue, Dec 10, 2019 4:30 PM 16:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

Enneagram Type Lexicon  6-week Master Class
Join Katherine as she teaches about the words and phrases the Types prefer to use and why.

Learn about the:
• Most common words and phrases of each of the 9 Types
• Common patterns of those that were initially mistyped
• Patterns of those that are outliers
• Words and themes that can explain differences among types.

Beginning October 15, 2019 to November 19, 2019
Fee:  $395 Early Bird Special until September 23rd, then $495 after September 23rd
Format:  Six online classes, 2.5 hours in length, meeting once a week on Tuesdays
Day:  Tuesdays
Time:  October 15, 2019, from 2-4:30 Pacific Time (2.5 hours)
Dates: October 15, 22, 29, November 5, 12, 19, 2019
How:  Zoom (free download, available here) - Make sure you have a camera on your computer!
Recorded: All teaching material is recorded unless otherwise specified. For privacy, all breakout groups are not recorded.  Recording available 1 week after the course, for a limited time.

Prerequisite:  *Required for certification with Katherine Chernick Fauvre but open to anyone

Lex•i•con: The vocabulary of a person, language or branch of knowledge.

Over the last 25 years, Katherine keeps refining the 12 key points she uses to most accurately determine Type.

One of the most powerful ways to recognize Enneagram Types, is in the vocabulary they use.

Long before she began her 22 Enneagram-related studies, she tracked and collected the words that job applicants used to describe themselves.

In the 1970s, she was in a position that required that she quickly and effectively hire the right person for the right job as quickly as possible.

It was a very costly and time consuming process to find, interview, hire, and train someone. Her hope was to make it easier to determine what qualities worked best for a particular job and how to recognize those that would be a good fit.

So, she began by tracking the word choices of those she interviewed to expedite the hiring process.
As with the Enneagram, she was intrigued by the similarities in the word clusters applicants used.
She initially found 8-12 personality clusters.

When she discovered the Enneagram, she ran an additional study and correlated her findings with what she had previously learned from those she had interviewed.

The focus of this course is:
• How to identify words and themes the types use
• Differences and similarities among types
• Common patterns of those that were initially mistyped
• Patterns of those that are outliers

Click here to register now and reserve your spot!

The first and more accurate dissemination of the types came from Ichazo and Naranjo. The early transmissions did not include books or written teachings by these creators. A therapist, Kathy Speeth who was in the Gurdjieff Work and was the girlfriend of Dr. Claudio Naranjo in the early 70’s, was the first to create materials on Ichazo’s view of the Enneagram and the first to teach the Enneagram publicly.
Katherine has had access to all of this information which is why she wants to refine the understanding of these Types so that people have the opportunity to discover their true Type and take advantage of the interventions that are available.
These are the most commonly mistyped Enneagram types due to errors in miscommunication regarding the original transmission of the Types. These errors were due to the fact that the creators of the Enneagram and the Instinctual Types, Ichazo and Naranjo respectively, had not written the first books that were disseminated.

9 Types of Empathy, 7 Levels of Empathy, 9 Types of Empaths and Your Way to Personal Empowerment: In-Depth, 3 Week, Master Class

  • Tue, Aug 6, 2019 1:30 PM 13:30 Tue, Aug 20, 2019 4:30 PM 16:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

9 Types of Empathy, 7 Levels of Empathy, 9 Types of Empaths and Your Way to Personal Empowerment
In-Depth, 3 Week, Master Class
Beginning August 6th, 2019
Fee:  $395 Early Bird Special until July 12th, then $495 after July 12th
Empathy is the invisible thread that connects all of us to one another. It is our innate sense of humanity. It is the ability to understand and share the feelings of  an other to put ourselves in their shoes.  All 9 types experience and demonstrate empathy but how? And why does it seem like some types have more empathy than others?  Discover how the 9 Enneagram Types and 3 Instinctual Types experience and express empathy… and how we may miss the manner in which loved ones show us compassion according to their type.
Format:  Three online classes, three hours in length, meeting once a week
Day:  Tuesdays
Time:  August 6th, 2019, from 1:30-4:30 Pacific Time (3 hours)
Dates: August 6th, August 13th, August 20th, 2019

Prerequisite:  *Required for certification with Katherine Chernick Fauvre but open to anyone

• Learn  9 different types of empathy including, but not limited to, mental, emotional,  somatic and experiential empathy.
• Learn what the 9 Types and the 3 Instinctual Types need to feel cared for. 
• Learn how each Enneagram Type expresses empathy according to the type’s self image, core fears,  needs, and concerns, and defense strategy.
• Discover how you can develop personal empowerment by recognizing the manner in which you demonstrate empathy.

Enneagram and Psychology The 9 Types of the Enneagram combined with a Psychological Perspective

  • Fri, Apr 5, 2019 4:00 PM 16:00 Sun, Apr 7, 2019 6:00 PM 18:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

Enneagram and Psychology
The 9 Types of the Enneagram combined with a Psychological Perspective

Qualified Human Knowledge

Can you navigate in yourself and the relationship with others as well as you can in your SmartPhone?

Aalborg Psykologerne know how important the relationship is to yourself and others for the well-being of the human being. Most can navigate - and are willing to invest in their SmartPhone if something doesn't work or problems arise. We now give you the opportunity to navigate in human knowledge and relationships - personally and work related - both when it works, but also when challenges arise. Aalborg Psychologists have chosen to focus on human understanding, and have invited one of the world's leading Personality Specialists from the United States for a 3-day life-changing experience.

Man lives and thrives daily in various social relationships. Through many years of experience, we at Aalborg Psykologerne have experienced how important or how "dangerous" relationships are for the quality of life. In order to be in healthy relationships, one needs understanding and insight into oneself - but also the people around one.

The course will teach you to spot different personalities with knowledge of the 9 personality types of the Enneagram mixed with a psychological angle. It gives you a unique opportunity to recognize and understand the behavior and motives of yourself and those around you. To be in a different way with your world - possibly. partner and children, family and friends - or colleagues and acquaintances. You will have the tools to recognize and regulate yourself - so you adapt, communicate, and understand in a unique and eye-opening way.

Join this 3-day Master Class on Human Knowledge from one of the world's leading specialists from the United States Katherine Fauvre and senior licensed psychologist Payam Peters.

It is not a prerequisite that you know the Enneagram in advance.

Date: 05.04.2019 - 07.04.2019.

Saturday 6th of April 2019 - 9.00 AM - 6.00 PM (full board incl. lunch)

Sunday 7th of April 2019 - 9.00 AM -6.00 PM (full board incl. lunch)
